The diagnosis is clinical:

o progressive increase in symptoms lasting at least two days and requiring a change in treatment

o not soothed by rapid-acting bronchodilators used frequently and in large quantities

o without returning to the usual state

properties.question: Which of the following is NOT a clinical sign of an asthma exacerbation in children and adults?
properties.option_a: A progressive increase in symptoms lasting at least two days and requiring a change in treatment
properties.option_b: Symptoms not soothed by rapid-acting bronchodilators used frequently and in large quantities
properties.option_c: Returning to the usual state of health after the exacerbation
properties.option_d: Frequent and large use of rapid-acting bronchodilators without symptom relief
